macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Diverge Sharply: Dow Up 1.5% YTD, Nasdaq 100 Down Over 3%
items.summary: The Dow Jones index rose nearly 1.5% year-to-date, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 fell over 3%, with the S&P 500 slightly negative at -1.5%. Growth stocks struggled amid AI disruption fears, contrasting with stronger value and international markets like MSCI Emerging Markets up 11% YTD.

items.title: Major Stock Markets Decline on AI Disruption Concerns
items.summary: Global stock markets fell amid worries over AI's disruptive impact across sectors, as investors await Q4 2025 earnings. US Treasury yields dropped ahead of key inflation data, with front-end leading the decline.

items.title: Tech Sector Volatility Surges with Cisco Drop and Nasdaq Swings
items.summary: Cisco shares plunged 12% on margin pressure, software ETFs fell 2%, and Nasdaq dropped 2%—its fifth 1%+ decline in ten days—driven by AI-related volatility. Markets eye Friday's CPI report amid falling Treasury yields to 4.1%.

items.title: US January CPI Report Looms with Expectations of Cooling Inflation
items.summary: Consensus anticipates core CPI deceleration to 2.5% YoY from 2.7%, potentially supporting mid-year Fed rate cuts despite low odds for March. Oil prices dipped on US-Iran diplomatic talks, while gold and silver saw modest losses.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Standard Chartered Predicts Bitcoin Crash to $50,000 and Ether to $1,400 Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Standard Chartered forecasts Bitcoin dropping to $50,000 and Ether to $1,400 in coming months due to ETF outflows and risk-off sentiment, with year-end targets revised down to $100,000 for BTC and $4,000 for ETH. Bitcoin is down nearly 23% year-to-date in 2026, driven by volatility and liquidations.

items.title: XRP Gains 3.3% to $1.40 as Capital Flows Back into Crypto Market
items.summary: XRP rose 3.3% in 24 hours to $1.40, tracking a broader market rally led by Bitcoin's 3.84% gain, with total crypto market cap up 3.36%. The surge ties to Ripple's new partnership with Aviva Investors for tokenizing funds on XRP Ledger.

items.title: Bitcoin Crashes 14% on Feb 5 Amid ETF Outflows, Still Seen as Top Buy
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 14% on February 5 due to cross-asset selling, derivatives liquidations, and $297 million in ETF outflows that day plus $635 million prior. Analysts maintain it's the best cryptocurrency to buy long-term despite potential further downside.

items.title: Crypto Market Down Sharply in 2026, Tied Tightly to Bitcoin's Performance
items.summary: Bitcoin is down 26% since January 1, 2025, as of February 12, 2026, dragging other cryptos like Cardano (-70%) due to high correlations (0.6-0.8) with BTC. Altcoins rise less on stock gains and fall more on tech selloffs.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Launches GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark and Retires Legacy Models
items.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark on February 13, 2026, marking a major new model launch alongside the retirement of legacy models, as highlighted in the day's AI industry recap.

items.title: Gartner Warns Misconfigured AI Could Shut Down G20 Nation Infrastructure
items.summary: Gartner issued a warning on February 13, 2026, that misconfigured AI in national infrastructure could disrupt critical services like power grids and transport due to unpredictable model behavior.

items.title: New AI Research Accelerates Alloy Discovery by Fusing Expert Knowledge and Data
items.summary: Researchers published a breakthrough on February 14, 2026, advancing AI for science by extracting and fusing cross-disciplinary expert knowledge with data to speed up alloy discovery.

items.title: Banks Triple GenAI Deployment into 2026, Eyeing Agentic AI Amid Data Quality Concerns
items.summary: 49% of banks have deployed GenAI entering 2026, up from previous year, with over 25% planning agentic AI investments, though experts stress fixing data quality first for success.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Workers Launch International Strike Over Job Cuts and RTO Mandate
items.summary: Around 1200 Ubisoft staff have gone on strike in response to massive impending job cuts and a return-to-office mandate. The company plans to hire external leadership for its Creative House amid cost-cutting measures.
items.source: Rock Paper Shotgun, Polygon, Game Developer

items.title: Discord Faces Backlash Over Global Teen Age Verification Rollout
items.summary: Discord is launching teen-by-default settings and age verification globally next month, following a data breach exposing 70,000 IDs. Users are pushing back against the new checks.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Reveals New PS5 Games Including Castlevania and Metal Gear Solid
items.summary: February 2026 State of Play announced titles like Project Windless, Castlevania: Belmont's Curse, Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol 2, Silent Hill Townfall, Rev.Noir, John Wick action-adventure, and God of War Trilogy Remake. Several games are slated for 2026 release.

items.title: The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin Confirms Launch Date
items.summary: The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin has confirmed its launch date, with a new interview video series featuring the original anime voice cast releasing on February 14.

items.title: Dungeon RPG UNDERDEEP Launches Crowdfunding Campaign
items.summary: Indie studio Hakony announced the crowdfunding launch for its new dungeon RPG UNDERDEEP on February 14, 2026.

items.title: Aggro Crab Confirms No Ongoing Updates for Peak, Focuses on New Games
items.summary: Aggro Crab revealed it never planned to update Peak post-launch and is developing Crashout Crew instead of supporting one game indefinitely.

items.title: World of Tanks Deploys Micropatch 2.1.1_4
items.summary: World of Tanks servers underwent maintenance on February 14 for Micropatch 2.1.1_4, with downtime from 10:30 to 12:00 UTC.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Announces $300,000 Long-Range Semi Pricing, Undercutting Rivals
items.summary: Tesla plans to price its long-range Semi truck at $300,000, undercutting competitors by over $145,000. This comes amid executive turnover and a 45% year-over-year sales drop in China.

items.title: Microsoft Issues Urgent Patches for Multiple Zero-Day Vulnerabilities
items.summary: Microsoft disclosed an extraordinarily high number of exploited zero-day flaws in Windows and Office, releasing fixes. Apple also patched a critical iOS zero-day exploit.

items.title: All Amazon Fresh Stores Closing Nationwide
items.summary: Amazon is shutting down all Amazon Fresh grocery stores, leaving locations like Rochester Hills vacant amid strategic shifts.

items.title: ServiceNow Acquires BusBork in Strategic 'Tuck-In' Deal
items.summary: ServiceNow completed the acquisition of BusBork despite CEO's earlier pledge against large-scale M&A, describing it as a tuck-in. The deal highlights ongoing consolidation in enterprise software.

items.title: Applied Materials Forecasts Strong Q2 Revenue on Chip Demand Surge
items.summary: Applied Materials expects $7.65 billion in fiscal Q2 revenue, driven by demand for chipmaking equipment amid recovering sales post-China export restrictions.

items.title: Coinbase Shares Rebound After Reporting $650 Million Q4 Loss
items.summary: Coinbase posted a more than $650 million loss in Q4 but shares are rebounding in pre-market trading amid crypto market recovery.
